column1: thinks that the best way to counteract phubbing is to be aware of it in the first place
thinks it could avoid phubbing if smartphones would stay in jacketpockets for the whole duration of the social interaction
thinks phubbing can be avoid with education about respectful interaction with each other
thinks to avoid phubbing it might help to turn off the notification sound or turn the screen away
Has the rule in family that cell phones have no place at the dining table during lunch (to avoid phubbing)
Consciously put the phone out of reach and hearing range ( conscious action to avoid phubbing)
consciously not taking the phone to a social get-together ( conscious action to avoid phubbing)
usually never has his smartphone with him during social interactions, as everything important is done via smartwatch
thinks the only way to reduce phubbing is to make people feel like shit if they phubb
thinks that education can maybe help people to understand that their smartphone use is disturbing a conversation
thinks smartwatch helps to not look at phone everytime a notification comes in -> looks on smartwatch instead of smartphone
